def: The theory of, or belief in, evolution. See Evolution, 6 and 7.
An African wild cat (Felis serval) of moderate size. It hasrather long legs and a tail of moderate length. Its color is tawny,with black spots on the body and rings of black on the tail.
One who, or that which, blows a horn.
Having four sides and four equal angles. Sir W. Raleigh.
Rather fast; also, somewhat dissipated. [Colloq.] Thackeray.
A large leather bottle for liquors, etc., made of the skin of agoat or other animal. Hence: A drunkard. [Obs.]You're an absolute borachio. Congreve.
Having a mind devoted to earthly things; worldly-minded; --opposed to spiritual-minded.-- Earth"ly-mind`ed*ness, n.
A figure by which a person seeks to convince and move by anelegant kind of upbraiding.
Moderately warm; not hot; tepid.-- Luke"ness, n. [Obs.]Nine penn'orth o'brandy and water luke. Dickens.
In confidence; in reliance on secrecy.
An acid salt. See Acid salt (a), under Salt, n.
